summary_distilbart: A recent systematic analysis showed that in 2011, 314 ( 296 - 331 ) million children younger than 5 years were mildly , moderately or severely stunted and 258 ( 240 - 274 ) million were mildly or severely underweight in the developing countries . The prevalence of malnutrition among elementary school aged children in tehran varied from 6% to 16% . In iran a national free food program ( nffp ) is implemented in elementary schools of deprived areas to cover all poor students . However, this program is not conducted in slums and poor areas of the big cities .

Anemia occurs in more than 50% of patients and may reach 90% in certain types of cancers . Blood transfusion is an effective way to replace depleted hb within a short period but the effect is temporary and can cause serious adverse risks and increased mortality . In randomized clinical trials in patients with caa erythropoiesis - stimulating agents ( esas) produced significant increases in hb level and decreased transfusion requirements .

Tardive dystonia (td) is a rarer side effect after longer exposure to antipsychotic drugs . It is characterized by local or general involuntary contraction of a muscle or muscle group . Olanzapine also improves preexisting symptoms of tardive movements . We report a case of a 20-year - old male with severe unilateral dystonic neck movements .

Insecticides currently are essential for large - scale effective and economical pest control . The non - target effect of some pesticides is in part due to their effects on insect immunity . The investigation of insect immune pathways and mechanisms of pathogen modulation can yield insights into components that may be susceptible to inhibition . The feasibility of targeted pest control via insect immune inhibition has been established for termites .

A 43 -year - old right - handed woman with history of glomus jugulare tumor in the left jugular fossa with intracranial extension into the posterior cranial fossa was transferred from another hospital for recurrent seizure - like spells . She was diagnosed with epileptic seizures but continued to have episodes during treatment with the antiepileptic drugs ( aeds ) phenytoin , levetiracetam , and lamotrigine . She had a 90% surgical resection of the tumor done in 2011 followed by radiation therapy in september 2012 .

infertility affects 1015% of couples who are trying to conceive . 15% of these cases are caused by male factors, which affect 1 out of 20 men in the general population . Non - obstructive azoospermia ( noa) accounts for a considerable proportion of male infertility . The etiological mechanism of noa is unknown, but factors such as oxidative stress were considered to have effects on spermatogenesis .

About 85% of  low - risk  pregnant women request that they give birth while receiving midwife - led primary delivery care . The objective of this study was to describe trends in transfers and perinatal outcomes among labors using 3 japanese systems of midwife-led care . In deliveries managed by independent midwives in japan, many intervention measures, such as oxytocin infusion, epidural anesthesia, episiotomy, suture , and instrumental delivery, are not available based on legal restrictions .

The aim of this study was to analyze the presence of the enpp1 polymorphism, not studied yet in korean population, to identify the association between genotypes and allele with type 2 diabetes and obesity . Enpp1, also called k121q, has a glutamine substitution for lysine at codon 121 . In women, carriers of the q allele had an increased risk for obesity development . Obesity increases the concentration of insulin in plasma and is the major contributor of insulin resistance .

Lipid apheresis may also induce the regression of coronary atherosclerotic plaque in familial hypercholesterolemia ( fh ) patients . fh is a group of autosomal dominant genetic defects resulting in elevated serum ( ldl ) cholesterol levels . Lipids are performed at only a few highly specialized centers in relatively low volume .

congenital absence of the ivc could be a rare risk factor for idiopathic dvt, especially in young individuals . venous thromboembolism ( vte) has an incidence of 1 to 3 per 1000 individuals per year in western populations . The patient had no history of previous trauma, surgery, insect bites, dysuria or joint symptoms .

An exponential rise in alzheimer 's disease (ad ) prevalence rates is predicted to parallel the aging of baby boomers creating a potentially unsustainable economic burden to the healthcare system . Many ad patients remain undiagnosed or go undetected until the later stages of disease . There is now a scientific consensus that the pathological events in ad initiate decades before clinical symptoms become apparent . If disease modification is realized in the coming decades, the need for improved methods of early detection prior to overt clinical signs will be accentuated .

The wnt/catenin pathway has been implicated in the development and progression of melanoma and a wide range of cancer types . Hhr6, a human homologue of the yeast rad6 gene and a principal component of the postreplication dna repair pathway, has been identified as an important regulator of canonical wnt / catenin signaling . Recent studies have shown that contrary to breast and colon cancer , metastatic progression of the melanoma is associated with decreases in nuclear and cytoplasmic -catenins .

The guanine heterocyclic ring is rich in chemical reactivity toward oxidants and adduct - forming species . In dna, 2-deoxyguanosine ( dg , mass = m) is the chief site for base oxidation due to its low redox potential . Many products that are characterized by their mass signatures can be grouped based on the site of reaction on the radical intermediate resulting from one - electron oxidation of dg .

Guaifenesin is an expectorant medication sold over the counter and usually taken by mouth to assist expectoration of phlegm from the airways in acute respiratory tract infections . The mode of action in treating infertility is not well understood, but it appears to decrease mucus viscosity . A 32-year - old male patient presented to his primary care provider for an infertility evaluation . The patient is a nonsmoker, who consumes little or no alcohol with no known allergies . A recent screening exam for pulmonary tuberculosis was negative and the patient had recently undergone a required military service physical exam . A repeat semen analysis demonstrated marked improvement in both sperm count and motility .

benguet is a province in the northern portion of the philippines belonging to the cordillera administrative region . There are about 27.5 thousand farms covering 30 thousand hectares of agricultural land . The province is also the largest producer of vegetables and fruits . Growing vegetables is considered a risk occupation in some areas in developing countries . Pesticide poisoning is one of the most prevalent health problems in the Philippines .

An isl1 positive population is localised in the secondary heart field ( shf) The shf or anterior heat field ( ahf) was identified as a splanchnic mesoderm underlying the caudal pharynx, which provides myocardium to the outflow tract during tube looping . It has been supposed that there may be a primordial cardiovascular precursor in the shf that expresses the three markers is lkx2.5 and fetal liver kinase 1 .

Primary diffuse leptomeningeal gliomatosis ( pdlg) is a rare neoplasm with a short survival time of a few months . Radiochemotherapy including temozolomide might be valid as a basic therapy for brain malignant astrocytomas . The patient died twenty - two months after diagnosis, being the longest survival time described thus far .

microalbuminuria ( mau ) is a predictor of cardiovascular disease ( cvd ) and death among subjects with type 2 diabetes ( t2d) Mau is one of the earliest clinical signs for diabetic nephropathy and a significant risk factor for progression to proteinuria . Cuban americans 35 years of age and older have the highest percentage of diabetes - related deaths compared with other hispanics .

Cancer is the second leading cause of mortality and morbidity in both developed and developing countries . Breast self - examination ( bse) is an important screening measure for detecting breast cancer . Women who correctly practice bse monthly are more likely to detect a lump in the early stage of its development .

Der p 1 was isolated from house dust mite fecal pellets (allergon) by a multistep procedure 6 involving immunoaffinity chromatography . The purity of the preparation was confirmed by nh2-terminal sequencing on an automatic amino acid sequencer ( applied biosystems , inc . ) and demonstration that enzymatic activity was completely dependent on preactivation with cysteine and totally inhibited by e-64 .

In a 47-year - old man, paraplegia of the lower extremities developed after he underwent an esi for recurrent pain . The patient felt his legs  going dead after the injection . A later neurosurgical evaluation showed conus medullaris syndrome . A second magnetic resonance imaging study showed the conus infarct . We believe the rarity of this complication should not preclude the continued use of transforaminal esi .

The role of amyloid in neuronal dysfunction has recently been extended by the discovery of small, soluble oligomers of the a peptide . These oligomers have been shown to be neurotoxic themselves and to inhibit long - term potentiation ( ltp ) in hippocampal slices . The amyoid cascade hypothesis now includes the essential role of a oligomers in the neurodegeneration process . This focused review will concentrate on the interaction between a and apoe and other inflammatory proteins .

The aim of this article is to present some of the most frequent musculoskeletal disorders of the elderly, including some misleading presentations . We used the following terms and some of its combinations : elderly, aged, epidemiology, fracture, osteoporosis, vertebral, hip, pelvis, arthritis, neoplasm, malignancy, myeloma, paget, gout , infection, microcrystal, and radiology . The loss of mobility and physical independence resulting from arthropathies and fractures can be particularly devastating in this population .

Migraine is the leading neurological cause for seeking medical care . The greatest impact is on migraineurs with headaches on more days than not . The frequency of psychiatric disorders in both community and tertiary settings has not been compared before in a single study . Differences in methods of studies based in community or tertiary centers prevent appropriate comparison .

m1dg ( 3-(2-deoxy--d - erythro - pentofuranosyl)-pyrimido[1,2-]purine-6,10(3h,5h)-dione ) is mutagenic in bacterial and mammalian cells and leads to mispairing  when replicated in vitro by multiple different dna polymerases . Administration of m1g to rodents at doses from 8 mg / kg to 6 pg / kg leads to its rapid disappearance  from plasma due to oxidation and formation of a single metabolite .

A 60-year - old woman visited pain clinic with tactile allodynia and electric shock - like pain in the left dorsal scapular area around the t3 dermatome . She was diagnosed as phn about 1 month previously and attack of the herpes zoster was 1 year ago . After 1 month elapsed, electric shock like pain was reduced to a vas score of 30/100 . magnesium sulfate was administered via the intravenous route . for more accurate and safe delivery of magnesium to the target site, we applied magnesium using the transforaminal epidural injection technique .

Central retinal vein occlusion ( crvo) is a common sight - threatening vascular disease with prevalence rates ranging from 0.1%1 to 0.5%2 in the older adult population . Current treatment options include intravitreal injections of steroids or anti - vascular endothelial growth factor ( anti - vegf ) agents . It is crucial to differentiate between ischemic and nonischemic crvo .

Small bowel obstruction ( sbo) is one of the most feared complications after a gastric bypass . It can be chronic or acute and can range from a nuisance to the patient to a life - threatening emergency . The reported incidence of sbo after lgb varies widely, perhaps because the technique used in the operation also varies widely .

The static technique provides more stability than the mobile spacer technique in patients with severe bone loss .

Mental fatigue is common and can be a disabling long - time condition following a stroke . It has been estimated that about 3070% of stroke survivors complain of fatigue . The person who suffers from mental fatigue is able to perform mental effort just for short periods . The self - assessment scale for mental fatigue has been evaluated and the 14 questions had internal consistency with a cronbach alpha of 0.94 .

The crispr / cas9 technology is revolutionizing all facets of biology from medicine to agriculture . It has quickly displaced its predecessors ( e.g. zinc finger and transcription activator - like effector nucleases ) as the method of choice for genome editing ( carroll , 2014 ) for agricultural applications that have traditionally depended on gene - silencing for rna modification , crispr/ cas9 is a game changer .

Fept@fe3o4 nanoparticles can be used as building blocks to form nanocomposites with enhanced magnetic properties with the potential for novel applications . The presence of an inert oxide shell may function to inhibit agglomeration of the cores upon annealing . This is a necessary step in creating an ordered l10 fept bimetallic structure with a higher magnetic coercivity .

Ca / calmodulin - dependent protein kinase ii ( camkii) is a critical signal mediator . Camkii is a major synaptic protein that is activated during the induction of long - term potentiation ( ltp ) by ca influx through n - methyl - d - aspartate ( nmda ) receptors . camii also participates in glucose - stimulated insulin secretion ( gsis) in the perfused rat pancreas .

Health is not only related to the absence of the disease, therefore we need to conceptualize and operationalize what health is . We have come to understand that information about functional status is needed in order to appreciate the full picture regarding the health of an individual or a population .

The centers for disease control and prevention ( cdc ) and united states preventive services task force ( uspstf) recommend universal hiv screening for all pregnant women entering prenatal care . This screening enables hiv - infected women and their infants to benefit from appropriate and timely interventions such as antiretroviral and obstetric interventions . A woman who knows of her hiv infection early in pregnancy has a less than 2% chance of delivering an infected infant . without intervention, this risk is approximately 25% in the united states .

Gas6 is a secreted vitamin k - dependent protein present in the human circulatory system . Gas6 expression is widespread in many tissues, including immune cells, endothelial cells, vascular smooth muscle cells and adipocytes . The gas6/tam pathway was found to be involved in mediating adipocyte survival and proliferation in vitro . Transgenic animals that ectopically express the axl tyrosine kinase receptor also develop progressive obesity with elevated circulating proinflammatory cytokines and severe systemic insulin resistance . Both gas6 gene polymorphisms associated with childhood obesity have not yet been identified .

Infertile couples are prone to depression, anxiety, loss of self - esteem and dissatisfaction with their sex life more than others . The frequency of anxiety in infertile couple has been reported in a wide range from 48% to 96% . In societies that define women as the main source of fertility, starting assisted reproductive treatments with limited successful outcomes could be harmful to these women's mental health .

The plant has been claimed to be used in the management of several diseased conditions such as hepatitis, dermatitis, jaundice, gastroenteritis, eczema , constipation and diarrhoea . There is no study in the open scientific literature that has reported on the exact bioactive abortifacient agent(s) in senna alata leaves . The present study aimed to validate the speculation that the alkaloids in aqueous extract of the plant are responsible for its abortifactionient activity .

erg protein expression has been recently suggested to be reflective of erg gene rearrangements in prostate cancer ( pca ) A recent report by our group demonstrated an association of erg expression with lethal disease in patients with unsuspected and advanced / castrate resistant disease who were treated by transurethral resection of prostate . We documented significant association between erg expression and both gleason score and tumor volume .

The asma originates from the ata with a 1 - 1.5 cm long main trunk and then gives off its lateral and medial branches .

The aim of the present study was to examine the influence of gastrocnemius stretching combined with joint mobilization on wb ankle df prom . 11 male subjects were asked to place both hands on the wall and then lean forward without heel - off  and knee flexion until maximum stretch was felt in the gastrocnicius on the tested leg . Subjects leaned forward against the wall in the same lunge posture as that during measurement of ankle DF prom with knee extended .

Dox is an antibiotic anthracycline that was isolated from a pigment of streptomyces peucetius in the early 1960s . It had been employed for more than 30 years in the battle against cancer . Dox has a direct renal damaging effect as it accumulates preferentially in the kidney . Dia is a new anti-inflammatory, analgesic and antipyretic drug that was developed specially for the treatment of osteoarthritis .

Suicide is a leading cause of death among adolescents and has become a significant public health issue globally . Suicide is the second to third cause of mortality among adolescents in the western world and is an important concern in developing countries . The prevention of inappropriate wcb among adolescents is imperative to protect them from negative physical and psychosocial consequences . In the present study, we investigate not only the association between inappropriate wCB and suicide ideation and attempt but also the difference in this association with body mass index and body weight perception .

fnas represent an advantageous , effective means to obtain diagnostic cellular material as they can often sample a wide area of the target lesion . They acquire tumor cells with lower contamination by background stromal connective tissue elements . The ultimate goal is to prevent unnecessary repeat procedures to obtain additional tissue just for molecular studies which can lead to delays in treatment .

These tumors are classified as typical net ( tnet ) , goblet cell carcinoid ( gcc ) and atypical gcc histologies . These tumors have a distinctive morphology showing tight clusters of cells with compact nuclei and abundant intracytoplasmic mucin . The most common site of metastasis is the liver .

igg4-rd is a newly recognized fibroinflammatory condition of unknown etiology . It is characterized by tumefactive lesions, dense lymphoplasmacytic infiltration rich in igg44-positive plasma cells and storiform fibrosis . The kidney is one of the organs commonly affected by the condition, and tubulointerstitial nephritis ( tin) is the predominant type of kidney lesion .

Hcv infection frequently persists and may cause cirrhosis and hepatocellular carcinoma . Interferon - based therapy is widely used for the treatment of chronic hcv . Treatment duration lasts for months and is often fraught with potentially dangerous side effects .

According to the korean national statistical office, the main cause of death in korea was cancer in 2012 . The total number of deaths due to cancer in Korea in 2012 was 267,221 which was increased by 9,825 ( 3.8% ) compared to 2011 . Currently the treatment of cancer patients in the medical field consists mainly of surgery , radiation therapy , and chemotherapy .

A 42-year - old man with a history of unexplained hip, rib, scapula and metatarsal fractures presented to our clinic for evaluation of a paranasal sinus tumor . Magnetic resonance imaging ( mri) showed an ethmoid mass extending through the cribriform intracranially . The patient underwent a combined endoscopic endonasal approach to the anterior skull base with tumor resection . He had normalization of phosphate, alkaline phosphatase , vitamin d and other laboratory values .

invasive mole is penetration of molar tissue ( complete or partial mole ) into myometrium or uterine vasculature ( 1 , 16 , 19 ) and metastasis can occur from direct extension of another pelvic neoplasm or by hematogenous or lymphatic spread or by transcelomic dissemination . The pathogenesis of sarcopenia is associated with many intrinsic and extrinsic factors, including proinflammatory cytokine accumulation, oxidative stress, mitochondrial dysfunction, insulin resistance and aging - related loss of anabolic hormones and motor neuron end plates . The loss of skeletal muscle results from an imbalance of protein metabolism . The protein degradation systems in skeletal muscle are modulated by a coordinated network of signaling pathways activated by hormones and cytokines .

The henna is a flowering plant native to northern africa, western and southern asia in semi - arid zones . It has been used to paint the skin for adornment and religious reasons for 9000 years and in over 60 countries . In most cases, the added ingredient is ppd , a powerful sensitizer that should not be directly applied to the skin as it may cause mild contact dermatitis . It is important for the population to be aware of this circumstance and the risk entailed by sensitization to ppd .

The romaleidae family accounts for more than 200 species of grasshoppers . It is the second most diverse family of the superfamily acridoidea occurring from semiarid regions to tropical rainforests . The genus radacridium is dispersed across the northeast region of brazil . The constitutive heterochromatin ( ch ) in romaleids is predominantly located in the pericentromeric regions of all chromosomes .

The aim of this study was to identify the optimal cut - off points of hs - crp in new - onset ( previously undiagnosed ) people with dm diagnosed based on the current 2-hpg , fpg , and hba1c diagnostic criteria .

In 1990, the adenine to guanine transition at the mTDna position of 3243 encoding trna was found to be the molecular basis for mitochondrial encephalomyopathy with lactic acidosis and stroke - like episodes .

There is limited research regarding the effects of microgravity on the peripheral nervous system . Ground - based models are a suitable alternative to space flights and induce similar modifications in the neuromuscular system . The 6 head - down tilt ( hdt) is another experimental model used to simulate the space flight environment of humans . The current study aimed to investigate the nerve conduction characteristics of rhesus monkeys .

A 55 year - old man had undergone off - pump coronary artery bypass grafting ( cabg) 10 years ago because of unstable angina associated with three vessel coronary artery disease . The patient had been free of angina and the 5-year angiography showed all patent grafts and the myocardial spect demonstrated no perfusion decrease at post-surgery 5 years after surgery . A redo of cabg was performed 10 years after the initial surgery because of an increasing frequency of . angina . The prevalence of celiac axis stenosis was 7.3% in a korean population although it was lower than previously .

A 78 year - old woman underwent extracapsular cataract extraction with phacoemulsification via temporal clear corneal and a single superior side port incision . A nurse inadvertently handed over the wrong syringe and high dose antibiotics and steroids were inadvertently injected into the anterior chamber and cornea stroma during the stromal hydration procedure for wound closure at the incision sites . The patient complained of blurred vision and foreign body sensations .

Adpkd is characterized by cyst formation and occurs primarily in the kidneys . The underlying cause is a mutation in the polycystin-1 and -2 plasma proteins located in the primary cilia . This mutation leads to abnormal function of renal tubular epithelia and inadequate calcium influx . cardiovascular disease is the most frequent cause ( 36% ) of mortality in patients with adpkkd .

Children with radiosensitive malignant malignant tumors typically require radiation therapy for a number of sessions over a period of several weeks . Although the procedure is painless, young children need to be sedated or anesthetised in order to provide a motionless state during the procedure . A 2.5 year - old boy with acute lymphoblastic leukaemia ( all ) was scheduled for radiotherapy . The report describes the accidental detection of a missed complication at the time of radiotherapy, from the previous chemotherapy , which was preliminarily and unduly attributed to anesthesia .

More than 2.5 million muslims from about 140 countries go on the hajj pilgrimage . Viral or bacterial respiratory tract infections are very common among pilgrims in all age and sex groups . Each country plans and implements some specific measures to prevent and control these diseases among pilgrims .

Care coordination is an important aspect of nursing care especially for elderly patients admitted to an acute care setting . in singapore care coordination and transitional care nursing is a new concept of care . The objective of this paper is to explore the characteristics of elderly patients receiving care coordination , determine care gaps and intervention during home visit and telephonic review .

The aim of endodontics is a three - dimensional unblemished seal of the root canal system which is achieved by perfect designing of the canal diameter and canal form . The root dentin becomes a gateway to dentinal cracks and minute intricate fractures . as a result of craze lines or microcracks, there might be occurrence of root fracture that propagates due to repeated application of stress by the occlusal forces .

A batch plant producing multiple products is categorized as either a multiproduct plant or a multipurpose plant . All the products follow the same path through the process and only one product is manufactured at a time . Processing of other products is carried out using the same equipment in successive production runs or campaigns .

Since the introduction of extra - oral implants in reconstruction of craniofacial defects, achieving proper prosthesis retention has become more promising . The ideal position and number of implants for restoring orbital defects would be three non - linear implants in lateral , supraorbital , and infra - orbital rims . However, such implant arrangement is not always conceivable considering the extension of the defect and bone quality and quantity of defect s walls . The purpose of this article was to present a case treated with an implant - supported prosthesis to reconstruct a relatively large orbital defect using three adjacent implants in the lateral orbital rim .

The high hcc rates in china largely reflect the elevated prevalence of chronic hepatitis b virus ( hbv ) infection . In developed countries such as united states, nonalcoholic fatty liver disease ( nafld ) associated with obesity is associated with hcc . This study is about the influence of body mass index ( bmi ) and waistline on complications, postoperative death and long - time survival in patients undergoing surgery for hcc patients .

professional mononuclear phagocytes ( pmn) are considered as the first line of defence of the early host innate immune response . Their main function has been classically understood to kill invasive pathogens by a variety of potent microbicidal effector mechanisms . Within blood circulatingÂ phagocytes are by far the most abundant cell population representing 5080% of the total white blood cells in different vertebrates .

Most malignancies of the upper aerodigestive tract ( figure 1) are squamous cell carcinomas . Squamous cells are the primary tumor type in head and neck cancer . About 5%10% of suspicious lesions arising in the mucous membranes of the mouth, pharynx and larynx undergo malignant transformation .

Alcoholic liver disease (ald) represents a spectrum of clinical illness and morphological changes that range from fatty liver, hepatic inflammation, necrosis ( alcoholic hepatitis ) to progressive fibrosis (alcohol cirrhosis) Many of the toxic effects of ethanol in the liver have been associated with its metabolism . ethanol oxidation generates toxic products such as acetaldehyde and reactive oxygen species result in oxidative stress that initiates apoptosis and cell injury . The study determined the effect of curcumin on early stage of ethanol - induced liver inflammation and improved pathology .

This study provides class iii evidence that more patients are seizure - free and have stopped aed treatment in the long term after resective epilepsy surgery than nonoperated epilepsy patients . All epilepsy surgery procedures are reported to the snesur in sweden, which was initiated in 1990 . The follow - up has been extended from 2 years to 5, 10, and 15 years postoperatively .

The prevalence of obesity among adolescents in the united states has increased dramatically in the past 30 years . Currently 33.6% of all adolescents 1219 years of age are either overweight or obese . Little is known about the frequency of weight - related counseling given to different racial / ethnic groups or those with limited access to care . The findings can provide guidance for policies and programs in a state with high rates of adolescent overweight or obesity .

The students at taibah university, saudi arabia, take a preclinical full - year endodontic course in the 3 year of their 6-year bachelor of dental surgery degree . The course consists of 28 h of theoretical lectures and 28 3-h laboratory sessions during which they perform technical aspects of root canal treatment on extracted single- and multi - rooted teeth . In the 5 - year course students perform root canal treatments as part of a comprehensive dentistry care course under supervision of specialists . A questionnaire was distributed to 19 4-year and 25 5 -year students in the final month of the academic year after they had had the maximum amount of training .

A 36 -year - old woman complained of an insidious onset of generalized myoclonus that first became apparent at age 27 . She had no history of febrile convulsions or seizure, infectious disease in the central nervous system, exposure to toxic materials or intake of herbal drugs . The patient was alert and oriented and her mini - mental state examination score was 30 . She did not have gaze palsy and her vision and hearing were normal . However, her voice was tremulous and generalized positive myoconus was observed at four extremities and body .

With the worldwide spread of mycobacterium tuberculosis ( mtb ) strains resistant to both isoniazid and rifampicin, multidrug - resistant ( mdr ) tuberculosis (tb ) has become a major public health problem posing formidable challenges due to its complex diagnostic and treatment requirements . Xpert mtb / rif assay ( cepheid ) is one such technique which detects mtb as well as mutations that confer resistance to rif in > 2 h .

The hallmark of autoimmune diseases is the pathologic activity of the immune system of an organism directed against its own cells and tissues . within the systemic autoimmune rheumatic diseases ( sard ) anti - nuclear antibodies ( ana ) directed against various cellular components are fundamental for diagnosis . ana detection by indirect immunofluorescence ( iif) is still considered the gold standard . At a 1 : 40 serum dilution, 2530% of healthy individuals may test positive for ana and this increases even further upon ageing .

Multidetector computed tomography (mdct) has become the main investigation of choice in locoregional and distant staging of many tumours within the abdomen and pelvis . The purpose of this pictorial review is to discuss the imaging appearances on ct of some of the more common cancers arising from the abdomen . These include tumours from the stomach, pancreas, colon, kidney, ovary and prostate .

The long - term use of immunosuppressive agents for prevention of allograft rejection increases the risk of malignancy approximately 100 times as high as that in the general population . The prevalence rate of post - transplant malignancies in total differs between geographical areas . In europe, the rate is 1.6% and in australia is 24% with a mean of 6% . Skin cancers are the most common tumors among persons have solid organ transplantation .

The chance of developing invasive breast cancer at some time in a woman 's life is a little less than 12% . Breast cancer is the second leading cause of cancer death in women, exceeded only by lung cancer . The disease relapses in the form of metastasis within 5 years of surgery in about half of apparently localized tumors .

Forensic odontology has established itself as an important and often indispensible science in medicolegal matters and identification of the dead . Dental remains are the most stable biological evidence encountered in crime cases and yield useful information . The presence of blood group and rhesus factor antigens in tooth dentin and enamel makes a possible contribution in human identification even in decomposed bodies .

cystic echinococcosis ( ce) is a severe zoonosis caused by the cyclophyllidean cestode echinococcus granulosus . The disease has a worldwide distribution with endemic regions in many countries of the mediterranean basin, north and east africa, western and central asia, china, south america, and australia . The annual ce - associated economic losses on a global basis have been recently estimated to be at least over us$2 billion .

Septic internal jugular vein - sigmoid sinus thrombosis is a rare condition that complicates local and regional infectious inflammatory processes occurring in the head and neck . The patient died from severe pneumonia due to septic emboli after one week . The central venous catheter was removed and antibiotics were administrated through a different intravenous route . Despite these managements, the patient was stupor the next day .

Patients reportedly develop bisphosphonaterelated osteonecrosis of the jaw ( bronj) that is caused by subsequent dental surgery . These patients reportedly often often develop  bisphposonate related osteone crosis of jaw . The american association of oral and maxillofacial surgeons position paper published in 2014 and the committee recommended changing the nomenclature of bronj to the term  medicationrelated oste one-jaw . The patient developed mronj and died of sepsis .

The study reviewed research reports dealing with nonpharmacologic interventions aimed at preventing type 2 diabetes with early lifestyle interventions . The results from the randomized controlled trials all show that people with impaired glucose tolerance who received enhanced lifestyle advice had significantly lower ( on average 50% reduced ) incidence of type 2 Diabetes compared with those who received  usual care .

The function of sensory receptors ( nrec) in the movement control , muscle coordination and perception of the space position of temporo - mandibular joint ( tmj) is fundamental although the presence of nrec in the tmJ is still debated . The aim of this study is to ascertain the presence and the distribution of  nrec . The study was approved by the bioethics committee of the department of odontology and surgery of university of bari .

The incidence of mental disorders is 10% among the young adults . University students are the future investment in each society and their mental health is of great importance . The university entrance process influences students mental health through educational stressors, immigration to major cities, being far from the family, facing financial problems , etc . In the recent past, some psychologists have turned to new educational and treatment methods .

Polycystic ovary syndrome ( pcos) is known as one of the most common endocrine hormones disorders in the women of the reproductive age afflicting as many as % 10 of them . The rate of prevalence of this syndrome reported in the different studies is varied . Some studies which used sonography as their diagnostic criteria found that the prevalence of pcos ranged between 21% and 22% respectively . Some other symptoms and signs which can be enumerated for pcos include increased androgenic hormones, metabolic syndrome ( insulin resistance ) and fat - related disorders .

Milrinone increases the level of cyclic adenosine monophosphate in the myocardium and vascular smooth muscle . It increases calcium influx and relaxes vascular smooth muscles . The safety and efficacy of long - term use of milrinone in children is limited due to a lack of sufficient evidence - based studies in pediatric populations .

Brown - squard syndrome occurs due to dysfunction of the spinothalamic tract . Most management guidelines focus on penetrating cervical injuries and/or vertebral artery ( va ) injury . In this article, we report a rare case of va penetration by an electric screw driver bit with spinal cord insult . penetrating injury is the third most frequent cause of spinal cord injury in adults, surpassed only by traffic accidents and falls .

vkh is a granulomatous inflammatory disorder affecting the eyes, auditory system, meninges, and skin . It accounts for approximately 16% of all uveitis cases in china . Recent studies report a significant association of the inner segment ( is)/os junction and the cone outer segment tips ( cost ) line in various retinal diseases with visual function [ 1113 ]

Protein separation techniques and peptide analysis by mass spectrometry have greatly improved in the past decade . These techniques have become powerful tools for defining the composition of complex proteomes and the functions of protein complexes . The final step in most strategies involves analysis of tryptic peptides by lc - ms / ms . However, undersampling will occur and only a subset of the peptides will be identified .

There is increasing evidence of a clear genetic link between the phenotypic characteristics of dogs and adverse drug reactions . The fields of pharmacogenetics and pharmacogenomics have become increasingly promising regarding the clinical application of genetic data to aid in prevention of adverse reactions, prediction of the behaviour of drugs and discovery of new drug targets for study .

The emergency department ( ed ) is known to be one of the most congested units in any hospital that faces greater pressure in terms of patient load and health care resources as compared to other departments of the health care system . Quality of care decreases when the ed is overcrowded . An efficient patient flow system serves critical patient quickly minimizing unnecessary delay in treatment .

Primary intracystic squamous cell carcinoma ( scc) in the breast is an extremely rare neoplasm . It can arise from metaplastic epithelium associated with other primary malignancy of the breast, metastasis from primary elsewhere in the body or an extension of the skin covering . A 45 -year - old female presented with a lump in the right breast, which she had noticed since three weeks .

There is sound evidence supporting cognitive - behavioral therapy ( cbt ) in the treatment of depression but little direction about adaptation to inpatient settings . For individuals with depression who do not require hospitalization may find an optimal treatment format to be brief, weekly sessions . The logistics of organizing a more time - intensive program are less ( especially since the patients might otherwise not be occupied for much of the day ) and hospital staff are already present .

Retinal vein occlusion ( rvo) is an obstruction of the retinal venous system . It is the second most common cause of retinal vascular disease after diabetic retinopathy . The incidence of rvo has been estimated to be 0.12%/year in adults aged 45 years for brvo and 0.04% for crvo in caucasian populations . In the wisconsin beaver dam eye study, 12% of eyes that developed severe visual impairment (best corrected visual acuity 20/200 ) during a 15-year followup were due to rvo .

Diabetes management during ramadan fasting poses challenges to the treating physician . Pre - ramadan diabetes assessment, evaluations and diabetes education are important for successful management . Unplanned diabetes management during fasting may lead to hypoglycemia . This risk can be reduced by extensive diabetes education and medication adjustments . Diabetes education plays a central role, and diabetic patients should be given education and counseling .

Pseudoprogression ( pspd ) and pseudoresponse ( psr ) following anticancer therapy are major areas of controversy in the management of high - grade glioma . Novel imaging modalities such as mr spectroscopy and positron emission tomography are showing promising results but have yet to be validated in prospective studies .

The fontan procedure is used to separate the systemic and pulmonary circulations in patients with various forms of functionally univentricular hearts . In the fontan circulation, systemic venous return is sent to the pulmonary arteries without passage through a ventricle . The liver parenchymal injury, fibrosis and cirrhosis of the liver can cause hepatocellular carcinoma ( hcc) The prevalence and risk factors of cirrhotic changes and hccs have not been clearly identified .

This case describes a young non - pregnant cat that presented with uterine prolapse in association with an unusual diffuse , polypoid , fibrosing perimetritis and parametritis . Polypoid inflammation may have contributed to increased laxity of the uterine ligaments and predisposed to the development of uterine Prolapse .

Some gram - negative bacteria could express extensive multidrug resistance and significantly increase the rate of nosocomial infections in the hospital . The current study aimed to analyze the distribution of certain types of a. baumannii in clinical departments . Authors tried to figure out the roles of antibiotic - resistant genes and the therapies for the diseases in different departments with spread of crab and csab .

High phosphorus intake is known as one of the risk factors for impaired bone health . In human adults a diet containing p additives increases urinary hydroxyproline excretion , a bone resorption marker . in growing male rats, elevation in parathyroid hormone ( pth ) secretion is considered one of . the mechanisms by which a high p diet impairs bone metabolism .

Despite advancements in modern medical science and the health management industry, the incidence of cerebral palsy (cp) continues to rise . The emergence of sitting postural control in early infancy changes the way infants interact with the world . The purpose of this study was to investigate the differences of the pressure distributions of the sitting postures of typical developmental ( td ) children and children with CP .

The main goal of the study was to maximize bioethanol production from sugarcane molasses in batch fermentation process using previously isolated saccharomyces cerevisiae y-39 . yeast strain was used in this study . The study was conducted in a series of controlled laboratory experiments . The types of sugars in molasses were determined by the types of molasses determined by wickerham .

Retinal cell dynamics have shown that organotypic models can be comparable with in vivo conditions . The rpe is a monolayer of pigmented , cuboidal epithelial cells closely associated with the photoreceptor outer segments . This arrangement prevented any physical contact between the cocultured cells but allowed signal molecules to pass between them . This model could be useful for studying in vitro the interactions between the neuroretina and the rpe .

An endourologist does encounter stone disease in an ectopic kidney occasionally . The common management option for such stones is laparoscopy or ultrasound guided percutaneous nephrolithotomy (pcnl) The recently described micro - pcnl or microperc was used for two such cases . The stones were completely fragmented to dust with the laser .

Intra - radicular posts are commonly used to restore endodontically treated teeth if coronal tissue could no longer provide adequate support and retention for restorations . Ultrasonic energy is transmitted to the post causing cracks in the cement thus facilitating its removal . In vitro studies have evaluated post removal with ultrasonic devices by using roots of extract teeth included in resin  cylinders . This procedure is used in order to facilitate handling and test application . However the root is enveloped by periodontal ligament ( pdl ) which presents higher resiliency than resins used for root inclusion .

Human metapneumovirus ( hmpv) is an rna virus in the pneumovirinae subfamily of the paramyxoviridae family . It was first isolated in the netherlands in 2001 and has subsequently been identified worldwide . It has been implicated as a significant cause of hospitalization for young children .

Protein - coding regions account for just 2% of the human genome . The vast majority of non - coding sequences do not encode proteins . In recent years a great deal of effort has been directed toward the modification of  Â proportionsÂ of proteins for therapeutic applications . The most widely used protein semisynthesis technique is an extension of expressed protein ligation (epl)

Ameloblastoma is a benign but locally aggressive neoplasm of the odontogenic epithelium . It is aggressive because of the myeline nature of its growth and because its conservative treatment is associated with a high rate of recurrence . Primary resection of this benign tumor is considered the only predictable curative form of therapy . Unfortunately, this treatment leaves the patient with a defect in the affected region of the jaw .

Laparoscopic removal of a cervical stump following a supra cervical ( subtotal ) hysterectomy was first described by nezhat et al . The patient presented with persistent p v discharge and occasional post - coital bleeding . She had a history of postpartum hemorrhage and a family history of cancer of the cervix . In a retrospective of 41 patients, 98% of the patients were satisfied with their procedure, with 10% having monthly spotting .

The review describes the role of the fatty acid chains of ceramide in gsl - mediated outside - in signaling in promoting gsl- enriched domain - mediated cellular functions . It describes the activities of s1p in inflammatory reactions of keratinocytes in human . The most studied gsl enriched domains are membrane lipid microdomains on plasma membranes called lipid rafts . These are defined by their gsl rich nature, enrichment in proteins and membrane - anchored signaling molecules .

Anion templated rotaxanes and catenanes bind anions strongly and selectively in competitive solvent mixtures . Selective anion binding can be exploited to bring about triggered motion within the interlocked supramolecular architectures . These systems could be used in the preparation of molecular machines and switches .

3-polyunsaturated fas ( 3-pufas) are potent anti - inflammatory molecules . Epa and dha decrease expression of receptors for chemoattractants on blood inflammatory cells and prohibit migration of neutrophils or monocytes . The composition of fas was associated with stroke severity on hospital admission and functional outcomes at 3-months follow - up of patients with stroke .

Prediction of mandibular growth pattern ( mgp) plays an important role in orthodontic treatment planning . It is critical when managing the development of dentofacial structures . A study was conducted on 60 normal cephalograms taken from normal individuals . The samples had no history of orthodentic treatment or history of treatment or . history of systemic or developmental diseases .

established in 2003, erste foundation has a history stretching back 190 years to the year 1819 when it was founded as the erste sterreichische spar casse in vienna . The foundation recognises that contemporary society faces huge challenges and that for a new and united europe to work, integration is crucial .

The aim of this qualitative study was to explore the perceived informal learning achievements in undergraduate nursing programs from the iranian student perspective . The limited scope of formal nursing education in iran may result in informal learning experience for nursing students that differs from those of other countries . The study was conducted over a 2-year period ( 2009 - 2010 ) using a qualitative content analysis .

The in   vitro ageing of human diploid  fibroblasts ( hdfs ) has become a classical experimental model to study cellular ageing . Human fibroblast cells have a limited ability to divide when cultured in  vitro . After about 50 cell divisions,    hDFs enter a state of irreversible proliferative arrest, termed as replicative senescence . The mechanisms that are responsible for the continuous cell growth and increased in sa--gal expression in senescent cells have not been well elucidated .

Aging is the main risk factor for a variety of neurodegenerative diseases where specific proteins accumulate as pathological aggregates . The discovery of age - dependent protein aggregation in model organisms gives us the unprecedented opportunity to dissect the intrinsic cellular machineries responsible for preventing protein aggregation without using ectopically expressed human disease - associated proteins . At this time, very little is known concerning the regulation of widespread protein insolubility with age .

Nearly 50 million americans have hearing loss . Highfrequency hearing losses generally have a highfrequency component . This frequency region is essential for good speech understanding in complex listening environments . Acoustic amplification of dead regions does not improve speech understanding and may worsen it . An implant with a shorter electrode array provides beneficial electric stimulation for high frequencies while preserving acoustic lowfrequency hearing . We report results of the clinical trial leading to u.s . food and drug administration approval of the firstofitskind combined electric and acoustic ( hybrid ) implant system .

Canine visceral leishmaniasis (cvl) is an infectious disease transmitted by sand flies and caused by leishmania infantum . Domestic dogs ( canis familiaris) are the main reservoir hosts of human visceral leismaniasis in iran . The prevalence of cvl in various parts of iran is different and it is correlated by weather condition and humidity . Vaccination with naked dna is the latest method which promotes both cd4- and cd8-mediated responses .

arterial stiffness is increased in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus ( t2 dm) It can potentially increase the risk of morbidity and mortality associated with cardiovascular diseases (cvd) The aim of the present study was to identify lifestyle habits that are associated with bapwv in t2 m patients free of apparent cvd .

Weick and sutcliffe provide the most compelling depiction of how high - reliability organizations ( hros ) stay safe . They prize the identification of errors and close calls for the lessons they can extract from a careful analysis of what occurred before these events . These lessons point to specific weaknesses in safety protocols or procedures that can be remedied to reduce the risk of future failures . The hallmark of an hro is not that it is error - free but that errors do n't disable it .

Cefepime is a fourth generation cephalosporin antibiotic used to treat febrile neutropenia, severe infections related to the urinary tract, skin, nosocomial pneumonia and brain abscess . The main differential diagnosis of agep is pustular psoriasis . Agep is a rare acute reaction that is drug - induced in 90% of the cases .

Paediatric age at the time of diagnosis represents a negative prognostic factor for keratoconus progression . Younger patients represent a population at high risk for more rapid progression of the disease . The study comprised 516 eyes of 413 patients aged between 10 and 40 years . The surgical procedure of corneal cross - linking with riboflavina uva was performed in all patients according to the siena protocol .

rufinamide ( ruf ) is a triazole derivative that is structurally unrelated to other antiepileptic drugs . It was approved by the united states in 2004 for the treatment of lennox - gastaut syndrome ( lgs) in patients aged 4 years and older . The aim of this study was to delineate the long term efficacy and tolerability of ruf in children and infants with intractable epilepsies .

The international headache society defines cluster headache as attacks of severe, strictly unilateral pain which is orbital , supraorbital and temporal or in any combination of these sites . The first symptom of cataract is usually blurred vision and other symptoms that may progressively appear are glare , halos , double vision and perception of colours as more yellow and less vibrant .

Obesity is not only a risk factor for cancer development but also a factor affecting treatment outcomes . Early stage ec treatment involves surgery (total abdominal hysterectomy and bilateral salpingo - oopherectomy with or without pelvic lymph node dissection) followed by adjuvant radiotherapy in selected cases .

Hepatitis b virus ( hbv) is an important risk factor for developing hepatocellular carcinoma ( hcc) Hcc is the fifth most common cancer worldwide and causes significant public health problems . The most common cause of cirrhosis in shiraz transplant center in the country is hbV related . A two - year cross - sectional study was performed on 103 cirrhotic livers from the pathology department of the university of medical sciences .

A recent study showed that 43% of asymptomatic patients had clinical signs of dry eyes . If left untreated, ded can significantly impact a person s vision and quality of life . A diagnostic tool that can globally diagnose ded, regardless of the cause, may be valuable in helping physicians establish an earlier and more accurate dry eye diagnosis .

Approximately one third of patients are anemic before they undergo joint arthroplasty . Preoperative anemia is especially prevalent in patients with cancer and treatment plans often include surgery . ensuring adequate tissue oxygenation in the surgical setting frequently involves the administration of blood transfusions . Patients with preoperative hemoglobin levels between 10 and 13 g / dl may be three or more times as likely to receive allogeneic blood .

Curcumin,1,7-bis(4-hydroxy-3-methoxypheny l)- 1- 6- heptadiene- 3 , 5-dione , commonly known as diferuloylmethane, is the yellow pigment component of the curry or turmeric ( curcuma longa ) Turmeric extracts have been extensively used for the treatment of several diseases in ayurvedic medicine in india for several centuries . For the first time ever, curcumin affects sperm function ( motility / capacitation and acrosome reaction / fertilization ) in vitro and fertility in vivo .

splenic abscesses generally occur in patients with underlying comorbidities such as neoplasia, immunodeficiency, trauma, trauma or metastatic infection . Of the 600 cases documented in the current literature, most have been described as air confined to the left upper quadrant on chest x - ray . splenectomy is still debatable with the various modalities including antibiotics or percutaneous drainage .

Squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck ( scchn) is the fifth most common neoplasm with an estimated annual global incidence of more than 500,000 cases diagnosed worldwide . The treatment is usually interdisciplinary and mainly involves surgeons and radiation oncologists . The goal of the treatment can be to obtain (i) a high locoregional control and survival rates in patients with limited disease, (ii) an increased organ - function preservation in resectable and unresectable tumors .

Women perform better on verbal and memory tasks, whereas men excel in spatial tasks . Men show significant decline in several neurocognitivc domains while women evince no decline . Some sex differences are manifested not in the profile of abilities, but in the effects of aging within the range of young adulthood . Increased age was associated with decrease in performance on attention ( r=0.43 , p= 0.0001) and spatial abilities (r=-0.33)

inflammatory airway and lung diseases, such as asthma or chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (copd) are characterized by chronic inflammation . Many of the known inflammatory target proteins are associated with inflammatory signaling pathways . The pharmacological interventions protect against inflammation - induced airway - induced lung diseases will be discussed .

This is the first case report of multiple gastric carcinomas associated with polycystic liver disease of the liver, mesenterium and kidney . The patient had high serum levels of carcinoembryonic antigen ( 7.9 ng / ml ) and carbohydrate antigen 19 - 9 ( 202 mg / dl ) in the case provides a perspective for etiology of gastric cancer .

Canaliculitis is a common encounter in ophthalmic practice but supernumerary puncta and canaliculi ( spc) are rare congenital disorders . In a 59-year - old gentleman presented with painful swelling of the left lower lid for a week . The patient was treated with oral cloxacillin 500 mg , 6 hourly for 5 days .

The kingdom of saudi arabia is not exception of this global pandemic . The estimated number of adults living with diabetes has soared to 366 million , representing 8.3% of the global adult population . This number is projected to increase to 552 million people by 2030 , or 9.9% of adults . The prospective study of pravastatin in the elderly at risk ( prosper ) was a prospective multicenter randomized placebo - controlled trial . The study was conducted in scotland, ireland, and the netherlands . The participants were excluded from the study because of very severe cognitive impairment .

Dry eye is a disorder of the tear film due to tear deficiency or excessive tear evaporation . This causes damage to the interpalpebral ocular surface, and is associated with symptoms of ocular discomfort . Dry eye affects 20% of wearers of new - generation silicone hydrogel contact lenses . 75% of low - oxygen permeable lens wearers report a feeling of discomfort at the end of the day related to dry eye .

A 41-year - old man developed a small paracentral corneal perforation ( 0.5 mm in size ) in the right eye . The wound was managed with iatrogenic iris incarceration followed by application of cyanoacrylate tissue adhesive . The anterior chamber was immediately reformed and maintained .

The risk of developing one of these specific psychiatric illnesses is proportional to the amount of genetic material shared with an affected individual . Autism, schizophrenia and bipolar disorder have traditionally been considered as separate disease entities . There is some evidence for shared genetic factors for these disorders . The majority of psychiatric disorders are genetically complex and genetic complexity has been compounded by phenotypic complexity .

Fever is a common reason for seeking medical attention and accounts for more than 20% of emergency department visits . The objective use of the thermometer to detect the presence of fever is often limited to health care settings in most resource - poor settings . In developing countries where infectious diseases such as malaria and pneumonia are very prevalent, many parents rely on palpation to assess if their children have fever .

Pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma ( pdac) represents the fourth leading cause of cancer mortality worldwide . The incidence of 217,000 new cases each year is nearly matched by 213,000 deaths . Several lines of evidence implicate mutations inactivating the brca2 tumour suppressor in an estimated 520% of familial pancreatic cancer patients .

Central venous catheters are often used in the intensive care unit ( icu ) for monitoring and treatment of critically ill patients to provide long - term venous access . However their use may result in nosocomial catheter - related bloodstream infection ( crbsi) The estimated number of crbsI is approximately 250,000 annually in the united states .

There is a critical need to develop potent and selective therapeutic therapeutic therapeutic agents capable of targeting malignant tissue without compromising normal cell viability . Chemotherapeutic agents (e.g. doxorubicin  and docetaxel ) lack inherent selectivity desired to limit toxicity to normal cells . Administration of chemotherapeutics agents can induce drug resistance, resulting in disease progression . Development of more targeted therapies could circumvent nonspecific interactions and potentially overcome drug resistance in cancer therapy .

For patients with acute coronary syndrome, the key to increased survival and the preservation of myocardial function is rapid diagnosis followed by appropriate early intervention . The acquisition of a 12-lead electrocardiogram ( ecg) is an important step to assess the cardiac status in routine and emergency situations . The application of single - lead electrodes to the torso for standard 12 -lead ecg acquisition takes time . A relatively new praecordial v1v6, v - quick patch, has been developed and it provides a one - piece template for the placement of all six praeordial leads . The new patch has characteristics that enable it to conform to variations in thoracic dimensions while retaining the ability of providing accurate electrode placement

Phrynoderma, meaning toad skin, is a type of follicular keratosis coined and described by nocholls in 1933 . The site of onset was elbows in 106 ( 84.8%) patients, followed by knees ( 8% ) , buttocks ( 4%) and extensor extremities ( 4% ) in all (100%) patients . The lesions were discrete, keratotic , acuminate , and brown to skin colored papules with central keratinous plug . The surrounding skin was dry and scaly in 44 ( 35.2%) patients and pigmented in 72 ( 57.6%) patients.

Dieulafoy lesion is an aberrant submucosal vessel that lies in close contact with the mucous membrane . It is the cause of approximately 6% of upper gi bleeding . Diagnosis of small bowel bleeding is often delayed due to difficult access . A multidisciplinary approach is needed to obtain its proper diagnosis and treatment .

Obesity stigma and negative stereotypes of obese people are widespread and damaging to the health, dignity, human rights , and quality of life of obese individuals . Despite the oft - reported inefficacy of weight loss dieting, public health interventions may be unsuccessful due to a narrow focus on weight loss . Despite evidence that obese individuals may be metabolically healthy, overweight people live longer than normal weight persons .

Celiac disease (CD) is a common autoimmune disorder estimated to affect approximately 1% of the us population . The development of a CD patient registry requires significant resources including practitioners, informatics teams and administrative support . Prior studies have evaluated the reliability of international classification of diseases-9 ( icd-9 ) searches to identify patients with patients with CD with only moderate success yielding only 17% of sensitivity .

Bacterial vaginosis ( bv ) and vaginal candidiasis (vc) are the three infections most commonly associated with vaginal discharge . Trichomonas vaginalis ( tv) is also another common cause of vaginal discharge, but some studies have not found its association with pregnancy complications . Recent studies have demonstrated the co - infection of vaginal pathogenic organisms in pap tests . This study aimed to investigate the prevalence of pathogenic vaginal microorganisms and the presence of inflammation in pap smears among an iranian women sample .

The incidence of human brucellosis is estimated by the oie at 500,000 new cases per year worldwide . The majority of human cases worldwide is attributed to b. melitensis . Infection is transmitted by inhalation, animal contact and the consumption of dairy products and undercooked meat products . Infections are an occupational risk for farmers, veterinarians and abattoir workers .

Behet 's disease ( bd ) is a chronic inflammatory disease characterized by recurrent oral and genital ulceration and uveitis . The other clinical manifestations include skin lesions, arthritis, thrombosis and neurologic symptoms . polychondritis is known as a rare complication of bd and no case had been reported on until firestein et al. reported on five patients with both bd . The 40-year - old man was referred to our hospital for further evaluation of his fever , oral ulcers and skin rashes that had lasted for 10 days .

Finite element method is to find the solution for a complicated problem by replacing it by a simpler one . In finite element method, the actual continuum or body of the matter is considered to be interconnected at specified points, which are called nodes or nodal points . The technical improvement in computers and finite element software, has improved accuracy and speed of this analysis .

Male c57bl/6 mice ( 7 weeks old ) were purchased from oriental yeast ( tokyo , japan ) and housed in specific pathogen . Male mice were maintained under 12-h light / dark cycle, fed a standard rodent diet ( clea japan at nihon bioresearch ) and provided with water ad libitum .

There are 88 million persons aged 65 and above in china alone and the number is projected to increase to 341 million in 2050 . Disability prevalence in chinese elderly population has been increasing [ 35 ] in contrast to a declining trend in the developed countries [ 6 , 7 ] Disability in the elderly population is a major public health problem .

Recent approaches to cancer therapy have focused on developing methods  that specifically target chemotherapeutic agents to cancer cells . The most common approach to drug targeting has relied on the specificity of a monoclonal antibody for its tumor - specific antigen . A related strategy to achieve tumor - selective drug delivery involves the use of low molecular weight targeting ligands that can similarly deliver attached drugs specifically to cancer .

Each lab station consists of a laptop and the science workshop 750 interface ( ci-7650) with the datastudio software (ci-6870 g)

Type 2 diabetes mellitus ( t2 dm) is a growing epidemic . In the united states of america alone, nearly 25.8 million people ( approx 8.3% of the total population ) have the disease . Most conventional antidiabetic drugs ( eg . metformin , sulfonylureas etc . etc . often fail to slow the progression of diabetes . Despite the availability of a broad range of agents employing different mechanisms of action, there is a recognized need for new treatment options .

The goal of defibrillation ( df ) testing is to verify the detection of ventricular tachyarrhythmias by implantable cardioverter - defibrillators ( icds ) The absence of df testing may have medico - legal implications whether a device fails to terminate ventricular fibrillation during follow - up . Despite the stochastic nature of df, ineffective shocks during vf induction result in system modifications .

Bladder cancer is the seventh most common malignancy in the world in men and the third most common in poland . In 2010, 6296 incidents of bladder cancer were noticed ( 4919 men, 1377 women) mortality of this cancer is high, reaching 50.2% for men and 46.5% for women . In such cases, radical cystectomy is the treatment of choice, which connects with the necessity of urine diversion after bladder removal .

Online hemodiafiltration ( hdf) has been suggested as a possible cost - effective alternative to dialysis . The aim of this study is to assess the cost - effectiveness of hdf compared to hd by a simulation using existing study data . hdf treatment effectiveness has increasingly been understood to be positively associated with the magnitude of the convection volume used .

Alzheimer s disease (ad) is the most frequent neurodegenerative disease and is characterized by a progressive dementia that occurs in middle or late life . The neuropathological hallmark of ad is the presence of cortical intracellular neurofibrillary tangles ( nft ) and extracellular -amyloid ( a ) plaques ( braak and braak , 1991 ) which leads to synapse dysfunction, neuronal cell loss and subsequent brain atrophy . The most frequently used clinical diagnostic criteria for ad are the diagnostic and statistical manual of mental disorders ( dsm - iv - tr ; apa ) and the national institute of neurological disorders and stroke - alzheimer disease and related disorders ( nincds  adrda ; mckhann et al .

Sca3 is a slowly progressive and unremitting disease in which patients generally will become wheelchair - bound and bedridden in the end stage . The median survival time after disease onset is approximately 21 years . nerve growth factor (ngf) may have neuroprotective effects on cerebellar neurons and hence might serve as a therapeutic candidate of sca3 .

Nanopores are powerful research tools to investigate the structural and dynamic properties of single biomolecules . The ultimate goal of these studies is to develop an inexpensive method to sequence dna . The covalent attachment of dna strands has also been exploited to control the electronic properties of a pore . artificial pores that exhibit engineered properties such as voltage gating are attractive model systems for biological voltage - gated ion channels .

Skin is densely equipped with highly specialized sensory nerve endings capable of sensing a wide range of sensory stimuli such as light touch, mechanical pressure, temperature, itch, and pain . These cutaneous sensory afferents can be distinguished by many morphological, anatomical, electrophysiological, and molecular criteria . Here we took advantage of the ginip mouse model in combination with isolectin b4 cell surface staining and fluorescence - activated cell sorting ( facs)

The endoplasmic reticulum ( er) is an organelle with crucial biosynthetic and signaling functions in eukaryotic cells . The er is the major site for the biosynthesis of steroids, cholesterol , and lipids . It also provides the environment for the synthesis and folding of proteins destined to be secreted or embedded in the plasma membrane . These processes are assisted and monitored by resident chaperones and ca binding proteins .

Bevacizumab became standard of care as first - line treatment of metastatic colorectal cancer ( mcrc ) in association with chemotherapy . Not all patients benefit from bevaczumab treatment, but no biomarker has yet been identified that allows us to predict the benefit of association of bevacsumab to chemotherapy in mcrc .

The need to advance saliva research is strongly recognized by the strategic plan of the national institute of dental and craniofacial research . The ability to monitor health status, disease onset, progression , recurrence and treatment outcome through non - invasive means is highly important to advancing health care management . The analysis of saliva can provide a cost - effective approach for the screening of large populations .

bicipital groove ( bg) is an indentation on the anterior aspect of proximal part of humerus . This groove allows tendon of long head of biceps brachi muscle enveloped in synovial sheath and ascending branch of anterior circumflex humeral artery to pass through it . It is bounded medially by lesser tubercle, laterally by greater tubercle and superiorly by bridging of transverse humeral ligament /muscle fibers of subscapularis, supraspinatus and pectoralis major muscles .

Life skills are abilities needed to provide the groundwork for effective stress management and presentation of positive behaviors .  The United States office of crime and drug abuse prevention has reported 185 million drug consumers world - wide and an increasing treatment demand .

q fever is a zoonotic disease that is caused by coxiella burnetii, a microorganism that frequently infects domestic ungulates and wild mammals . The disease is transmitted to humans incidentally by inhalation of aerosols from infected cattle and sheep . In Japan, 60 to 84% of cattle with reproductive disorders are seropositive to q fever antibodies . In Korea, we examined the prevalence of antibodies to c.burnetii in dairy cattle nationwide and in people for health screening in rural area of korea .

tuberculosis (tuberculosis) is caused by the mycobacterium tuberculosis, a member of the m. tuberculosis complex . In 2010, there were an estimated 12.0 million prevalent cases of tb ( equivalent to 178 cases per 100000 individuals) and approximately 1.4 million people died of it during that year . Most of the cases in 2009 ( 55% ) occurred in asia . Some opportunistic microorganisms such as nocardia spp are gram - positive ( weakly acid fast ) and filamentous with a branching appearance and are not part of the normal human bacterial flora .

Proton magnetic resonance spectroscopy ( h mrs) is a noninvasive technique that allows us to provide an in vivo assessment of brain tissue composition . The symptoms of conversion disorder include paralysis of one or more limbs, ataxia, tremors, tics, and dystonia . The symptoms are due to an unconscious expression of a psychological conflict or need . conversion disorder is more common in adolescence than in childhood . Despite conversion disorder long - documented history conversion disorder remains diagnostic challenges for clinicians .

The disease is spreading most rapidly among iv drug users, blacks, hispanics, women and children .

Obesity is considered a major health problem and its prevalence has increased dramatically in the last decades . The number of people with diabetes mellitus has increased massively . The only effective therapy is weight loss . The aim of this review is to better understand the adipose tissue organ , reviewing the influence of variables that govern its ability to expand .

Patients with systemic lupus erythematosus (sle) are rare, with < 30 cases of ipso in patients with sle having only been reported (14) alp is an unusual but life threatening complication of sle, and usually presents with the acute onset of fever, cough, tachypnea and hypoxia . In a single patient, ipso was the initial presentation of sle and secondary onset of alp occurred after emergency surgery . The patient was thought to have strangulated intestinal obstruction .

The relationship between quality of life ( qol ) and perceived health are crucial for the maintenance of the welfare of military personnel and troop strength . The aim of this study was to evaluate military personnel from select branches of ground forces in taiwan for their perceived health status and qol .

The most important reason why athletes lose weight is that they want to compete in the lowest weight - class possible .

Parenting stress escalates at a much faster rate among mothers of disabled children in comparison to mothers of non - disabled children . The addition of a disabled child to a family requires parents to adopt new roles and responsibilities . Disabled children who rely on others for an extended period of time tend to cause long - term parenting stress in mothers .

Progressive nodular histiocytosis ( pnh) is a rare normolipemic macrophage disorder first described by taunton et al . in 1978 . It belongs to a subgroup of non - langerhans cell histioctosis, the juvenile xanthogranuloma ( jxg ) family . These disorders are difficult to categorize because of the diverse pathological findings and due to overlapping clinical and microscopic features .

Desmoplastic fibroma (df ) is recognized as an intra - osseous counterpart of soft tissue fibromatosis and is usually seen affecting the long bones , pelvis and only occasionally presents itself as a jaw lesion . The cause for df is unknown and is stipulated to have a varied pathogenesis ranging from genetic , endocrine and traumatic factors to an exuberant reactive proliferation . The mandible is most commonly affected when compared to the maxilla and the cranium in the head and neck region .

As people age, there is a concomitant decrease in muscle strength and muscle strength . This age - related change affects their ability to walk . The vertical ground reaction force is an external force involved in walking . We hypothesized that the relation between the joint moments and vertical ground  reaction force differs between the elderly and the young . The economic impact of influenza is immense due to the large number of lost working hours, hospitalizations and further medical complications . Although vaccines against influenza exist, the rapid mutation of influenza virus calls for constant surveillance and annual vaccine reformulation . The lack of a universal or broadly neutralizing influenza vaccine can be attributed to combinatorial complexity of the host immune system and the highly variable nature of viral antigens .

Amatoxin syndrome is of primary importance because it accounts for about 90% of fatalities . It is characterized by an incubation period followed by the gastrointestinal and hepatotoxic phases . The present paper analyzes the pathogenesis, clinical features, prognostic indicators and therapeutic strategies of amatoxin poisoning secondary to amanita phalloides intoxication .

Exogenous endophthalmitis generally arises from a direct breech of external - ocular barrier as a complication of ocular trauma or intraocular surgery . The main outcome measure of the study was the visual outcome at the latest follow-up visit .

The principal purposes of this paper are to demonstrate the shortcomings of the lever / beam model - based concepts that relate to the surgery of the mandible . The lever is an oversimplified structural representation of the jaw, so biomechanical concepts derived from it should be suspect . In the present context, the lever 's intrinsic vertical - only occlusal force is its primary drawback .

Smoking cessation with the use of electronic cigarettes led to reversal of chronic idiopathic neutrophilia . Cigarette smoking is a major cause of disease affecting several systems in the human body . Smoking cessation has important beneficial socioeconomic and health - related implications . Neuroblastoma is the most common extracranial solid tumor in childhood and accounts for 7% of malignancies in patients younger than 15 years . It originates from a developing and incompletely committed precursor cell derived from neural - crest tissues . mature mirnas can regulate the expression of a large number of genes at the posttranscriptional level .
