Some mirnas may function as oncogenes while some mirnas are supposed to be tumor suppressors .

altmetrics creates a new approach to evaluating the impact of publications by considering the number of downloads, shares, and discussions on social networks . This approach does not replace the traditional bibliometric indicators such as impact factor and h - index . Altmetrics allows not only researchers but also institutions to analyze postpublication activity around a paper in near - real time .

Diagnosis early allows for rapid implementation of the treatment preventing the advancement of the disease into its irreversible form that results in hand deformities .

The conventional approaches for the treatment of oa range from conservative measures to surgical intervention, and eventually joint replacement . The term glycocalyx ( sweet husk) was introduced 50 years ago to describe an extracellular polysaccharide coating of cells . It is now accepted that tnf, oxidised lipoproteins, lipopolysaccharides, thrombin, ischaemia / reperfusion , hyperglycaemia and growth factors all cause glycocalyX disruption via the action of proteases .

aldose reductase ( ar ) is a key enzyme in the polyol pathway known to play important roles in the cataract formation and the pathogenesis of diabetic complications such as neuropathy , nephropathy , and retinopathy . Ar inhibition is recognized as an important strategy for the prevention and attenuation of long - term diabetic complications . Ar inhibitors of ar and age formation provide an alternative mode of diabetes treatment .

zinc (zn) is the second most abundant trace element in the body after iron . Zn is essential for over 300 processes such as enzymatic catalysis, gene transcription, gene expression, dna replication, protein synthesis , tissue repair , and hormonal storage . zinc supplements are commonly used to alleviate a number of conditions, including zn deficient states, such as diarrhea and age - related macular degeneration .

Successful pain management treatment - defined as adequate analgesia without excessive adverse effects - can be challenging . An individual 's genetic makeup may predispose the patient to these adverse effects .

The term mucosa - associated lymphoid tissue ( malt ) lymphoma was first coined by isaacson and wright1 in 1983 . Autogenous grafting is the most commonly used surgical procedure for bone reconstruction . Autogenous bone grafts are considered the most suitable for the reconstruction of defects at oral and maxillofacial regions . It is the only type of graft that provides live immunocompatible bone cells essential to the stage i of osteogenesis .

Aluminium ( al) is ubiquitous in the environment and represents the third most common element in the earth s crust . The problem of al contamination in our environment has been around for more than 25 years . Al is found in materials used in the pharmaceutical industry and in manufactured foodstuffs, cosmetics and tap water .

macula - on rhegmatogenous retinal detachment ( rd) is a common cause of ophthalmic emergency that requires surgical treatment in a short period of time to prevent visual loss . The risk of rd is 4 times higher in patients who have undergone cataract surgery . The goal is not only to reattach the retina but to achieve an adequate final vision . The development of better surgical techniques has continued to improve the anatomical success rates .

oxygen species ( ros ) function as second messengers involved in cellular functions . The main effect provoked by several drugs is programmed cell death .

The presence of e. coli in fresh - marketed seafood indicates recent contamination and is usually attributed to infected handlers or storage on contaminated ice . The intensification of production and the consequent increase in stocking density have made fish farming more vulnerable to disease . The indiscriminate use of antibiotics to treat infections and promote growth has been shown to be inefficient in the long run and to put selective pressure on bacterial populations favoring the development of resistant strains .

However, it is a stressful procedure that affects all dimensions of patients lives . Social support is a key element to achieve an effective treatment management .

esophageal achalasia is a rare motility disorder involving the smooth muscle layer and the lower esophagus sphincter with its incomplete relaxation and increased tone . Primary hyperparathyroidism ( phpt) is a disease characterized by hypercalcemia due to autonomous production of parathyroid hormone (pth) Phpt is the third most common endocrine disorder in the west after diabetes mellitus and thyroid disorders . In developing countries, phpt is still uncommonly diagnosed and overtly symptomatic disease with skeletal, muscular, and renal manifestations . Phpt has become an asymptomatic disease in west with classic manifestations seen only in 2% cases nowadays .

Parkinson 's disease ( pd) is an age - related progressive neurodegenerative disorder associated with selective loss of dopaminergic neurons from the substantia nigra pars compacta region of the midbrain . Increasing evidence suggest that oxidative stress is a key contributor to the pathogenesis of pd . The metabolism of dopamine ( da ) itself contributes to oxidative stress that renders the nigral neurons particularly vulnerable . The most frequent dna lesion is 8-oxo-7,8-dihydroguanine, the oxidized form of guanine .

A stroke is a cerebrovascular event in which the supply of blood delivered to the brain is significantly altered . Up to 50% of stroke survivors experience lingering motor motor motor deficits . The majority of stroke patients are able to walk independently but most do not reach a walking level that enables them to perform all of their daily activities . Gait recovery is a major objective of rehabilitation programs for patients with stroke .

Heterotopic cervical pregnancy is extremely rare and most cases are associated with assisted reproductive technology . The study is a questionnaire - based survey carried out among a sample of 180 teenagers ( 90 boys and 90 girls ) aged between between 13 and 18 years old . The aim was to investigate relationship of actual body weight status and body weight .

Obesity has reached a historic high in canada with one - quarter of adults and 9% of children meeting the definition . Obesity and its associated comorbidities exact a heavy toll on health care systems and expenditures . In canada, the 2006 direct medical cost of overweight and obesity was $ 6.0 billion .

He could not remember his home address and phone number .

Asthma is a chronic inflammatory disease of the lower airways and is among the most common chronic conditions affecting children and adults . The more severe the clinical manifestations of asthma, the greater the difficulty in managing the disease . A history of wheezing has been reported in 46.6% of the children living in the city of salvador, brazil .

Antibiotic resistance is one of the most important public health problems worldwide due to morbidity and mortality and healthcare costs . 30% of all antibiotic use occurs outside spain and is largely due to the dispensing of antibiotics without a medical prescription ( dawmp) although this practice is unlawful, it is common in spain . morphea is an inflammatory skin disorder characterized by excessive collagen deposition . It primarily affects the dermis and sometimes extends into subcutaneous fat and fascia producing thickening and hardening of the skin due to fibrosis . At the most severe end of the spectrum, morphea may progress for years resulting in significant atrophy, joint contractures and functional, cosmetic, and psychologic disabilities .

Wegener s granulomatosis ( wg ) is an uncommon necrotizing vasculitis that most commonly affects the upper airways, lungs and kidneys . Early recognition and initiation of adequate immunomodulatory therapy are essential in limiting the potentially life - threatening aspects of the disorder .

Primary spontaneous pneumothorax is a benign disease, usually occurring in young patients without known underlying lung disorder . The occurrence rate is reported to be about 9 individuals per 100 000 each year . The therapeutic options include simple observation, needle aspiration, tube thoracostomy and definite operation . If surgery is indicated, video - assisted thoracoscopic surgery ( vats) using an endoscopic linear cutter to resect involved blebs is currently the most popular treatment .

Nuclear imaging accurately localizes the tumor in more than 90% of cases, obviating the need for advanced imaging modalities . Preoperative localization is essential for good surgical outcome . The most severe degeneration occurs in striatal medium spiny neurons and cortical projection neurons that extend to the striatum . Hd is the most common polyq repeat disease, with a prevalence of at least 1 in 10,000 in the usa and europe .

In early december 2013, a 44 -year - old man in tahiti had symptoms of zikv infection : asthenia, low grade fever ( temperature from 37.5c to 38c ) and arthralgia . eight weeks later, he described a second episode of symptoms compatible with infection . The patient did not seek treatment, thus biological samples were not collected during the first 2 periods of illness . He fully recovered from the second episode, but 2 weeks later he noted signs of hematospermia and sought treatment .

Irritable bowel syndrome ( ibs) is a common gastrointestinal disorder affecting approximately 1015% of the people in western world . The patient group is very heterogeneous and characterized by abdominal pain, discomfort and abnormal bowel habits . The strongest predictor for ibs is a prior gastroenteritic episode, which will increase the risk of developing ibs by 7-fold .

An intravenous bolus of 3000 iu of heparin was administered after placement of a 6-fr guiding sheath in the right femoral artery . The patient was discharged 7 days later and his postoperative course was uneventful . A 74-year - old man presented with progressive headache and dementia symptom for several months . He refused further treatment and did not seek hospital since then .

Population - based studies aiming to determine the true burden of neurological disorders have increasingly been acknowledged . However, in developing countries, the limited access of neurologists to rural areas and the logistic and economic limitations to perform neuroepidemiological studies have significantly complicated their implementation . A series of epidemiological studies was conducted in upper egypt in the last 2 decades . The project was designed to assess major neurological disorders in al quseir city .

Repair of anorectal malformation ( arm ) with rectourethral ( ru ) fistula involves the separation of two systems . This involves risk of injury to the urethra, ureters, seminal vesicles, bladder, and important nerves responsible for urinary control and sexual function . In group b, complications like urethral stenosis and neurogenic dysfunction were seen .

middle ear cholesteatoma is characterized by keratinocytic hyperproliferation with bony destruction and granulation tissue by chronic inflammation . The pathogenesis of middle-ear cholsteatoma has been debated for a century . In 1964, the american anatomist gray referred to middle ear as " skin in the wrong place " in 1964 . This simplified misdefinition stuck into literature and has been cited profusely in scientific papers .

accelerated molecular dynamics ( amd ) is an enhanced sampling technique that works often by adding a non - negative boost potential to smoothen the biomolecular potential energy surface . amd simulations capture rare barrier - crossing events that are not accessible to conventional molecular dynamics simulations . amd has been successfully applied to a number of biological systems, (10 ) and hundreds - of - nanosecond amd simulations have been shown to capture millisecond - time - scale events in both globular and membrane proteins .

A 40 -year - old man presented with left hemiparesis and left facial weakness which had developed four hours before admission after being struck on the right side of the neck by the edge of a door . Angiography performed on admission revealed near - complete occlusion of the suprabulbar portion of the right internal carotid artery . The patient 's mental status deteriorated suddenly and revealed a large intracerebral hemorrhage within the territory of the infarcted right middle cerebral artery . Endovascular treatment of the dissection was planned .

In this report  we describe a patient with hodgkin 's lymphoma who developed universal vitiligo after allogeneic bmt from his sister . The patient developed a small erythematous rash consistent with the clinical features of graft - versus - host disease ( gvhd ) of the skin . He underwent four times melanocyte - keratinocyte transplantation (mkt) for the treatment . All treated depigmented patches had a significant repigmentation .

Written informed consent was obtained from each participant after explanation of the nature and possible consequences of the study . Participants were recruited at the casey eye institute / ohsu according to the aig study protocol . The ocular light power exposure was 1.9 mw .

A six - year - old girl presented to us with history of mild pain in the left eye of two days duration . There was a black foreign body resembling a graphite pencil lead tip on the iris at the 7 o clock position . The child had not been examined by an ophthalmologist after the incident as she was apparently asymptomatic at the time . The patient was put on tapering doses of topical steroids and cycloplegics . Post - operatively a corneal incision was made at 5 oclock position with a 2.8 mm keratome . The remaining graphite particles were aspirated out .

Polyacrylonitrile ( pan ) is commercially important and used for the precursor for high - performance carbon fiber . in fiber applications , pan is dissolved in a suitable solvent and spin to fibers by a wet or dry spinning process .  Unfortunately, all the solvents mentioned above are unfriendly to the environment . to meet the requirements of  green chemistry, scientists have been searching for a green solvent to be an alternative .

Fistulae between the upper respiratory and gastrointestinal tracts are uncommon in adults . The etiology in adults is most frequently secondary to an esophageal malignancy . We report two cases of esophagobronchial fistulae . The use of virtual endoscopy also guides the clinician for the conventional endoscopic examination needed for biopsy and treatment .

People regard best practice decision making as consulting trustworthy comparison websites and magazines . They want their decision support tools to give them ratings that can be trusted because they are produced free of any conflict of interest or other biases . Consumers may regard themselves as having made good decisions, indeed the best possible decisions they could make . But some may wish to establish whether consumers have made an informed decision by seeing how well they score on a test of refrigerator knowledge .

Pancreatic intraepithelial neoplasia ( panin) is a nomenclature for microscopic proliferative epithelial lesions of the pancreas . Panin is assumed to be a precursor lesion of invasive ductal carcinoma ( idc) The moment panin-3 becomes idc has not been captured yet .

A 73-year-old man was referred to our hospital due to an elevated prostate - specific antigen ( psa ) level of 23.4 ng / ml . Hematological and biochemical data showed no abnormal findings aside from the elevated psa levels . A prostate needle biopsy detected gleason score 4 + 4 adenocarcinoma in his left prostate in february 2016 . The patient has not experienced recurrence or biochemical recurrence in the 10 months since radical prostatectomy .

The novottf-100a device is a new treatment approved by the united states food and drug administration ( fda ) for recurrent glioblastoma . The device emits alternating tumor treating electric fields ( ttfields) via 2 pairs of transducer arrays placed orthogonally on the scalp . Ttfields work by interrupting tumor cells during mitosis resulting in violent blebbing during cytokinesis, asymmetric chromosome segregation and aneuploidy .

The use of natural products in the prevention and treatment of oral conditions has increased recently and could be of benefit to low - socioeconomic level urban and rural communities . The only study available evaluating the clinical effects of aloe vera showed a significant reduction of plaque accumulation after use of a mouthrinse containing this natural product . The purpose of the present study was to assess the antiplaque and antigingivitis effects of this phytotherapic agent .

Primary mucinous carcinoma of the skin ( pmcs) is a rare adnexal neoplasm with sweat gland differentiation . It was first described by lennox et al . in 1952, and later designated by mendoza and helwig in 1971 . The large majority of specimens of pmcs arise on the face, especially on the eyelids and scalp .

A 66 -year - old man was incidentally found to have a 32-mm right lower pole renal mass on a computed tomography ( ct ) scan . A key risk of renal mass biopsy is seeding of the biopsy tract with malignant cells . The use of a coaxial needle allows multiple passes through the renal mass with only one pass through the surrounding normal tissue .

There is little quantitative information on the effects of small mole fractions of cholesterol on the phase diagrams, molecular organization and surface viscosity of mixtures of phospholipids and cholesterol . The raft hypothesis has emerged in recent years as a general organizing principle for the structure of eukaryotic cell membranes .

Pollution is predicated to all tiny particles in the air which are produced due to human or natural activities . World health organization ( 1992 ) has addressed the air pollution as a serious problem . The combination of natural and artificial factorscauses tehran to be one of the most polluted cities inthe world . 48 % of premature deaths are due to exposure to particulate matter in outdoor environments .

The syndrome is named after french neurosurgeon octave crouzon , who described this rare genetic disorder first time in 1912 . crouzon syndrome constitutes almost 5% of all craniosynostoses with an approximate birth prevalance of 1/25,000 - 1/50,000 . The patient underwent surgery to decompress the posterior cranial fossa . using a median incision the dura was opened in y - form and after arachnoid dissection duraplasty was performed .

Permanent postoperative hypoparathyroidism results from the unintentional removal or injury of parathyroid glands during thyroid and parathroid surgery . In the late 1960s and 1970s several new techniques were introduced in an attempt to prevent the detrimental health and social consequences of permanentÂ hypoparathroidism . Cryopreservation permitsÂ parathyroid tissue to be stored for potential reimplantation , thereby avoiding the risk of needlessly implanting parathyroroids during initial surgery .

A major feature of the movement toward hospital cost containment in the last decade has been the replacement of expensive inpatient care with less costly outpatient care . An incentive was created by the prospective payment system (pps ) to allocate costs to centers incurring outpatient charges . In 1986, congressional legislation in 1986 mandated the implementation of a pps for outpatient care for outpatient services .

Wilms tumor ( wt ) is the most frequent renal tumor occurring in children aged 0 to 15 years . Most patients ( 85% ) affected by wt can be successfully cured . Less than half of wt cases are attributable to known genes that are associated with wt risk . The exact pathogenesis of most cases remains unknown and identification of novel genetic loci urgently needed .

native hawaiians and other pacific islanders ( nh / pi ; e.g. , samoan , chuukese ) have higher type 2 diabetes incidence and prevalence compared to other ethnic groups . A culturally adapted diabetes self - management intervention called partners in care ( pic) significantly improved glycemic control and diabetes self care behaviors in nh/pi compared to a wait - list control .

Chest pa showed superior mediastinal widening and bulging of the right paraspinal interface . increased opacity of the infrahilar window and thickening of the posterior wall of the bronchus intermedius were seen on the lateral chest x - ray . An oval - shaped mass measuring 9.73.86.0 cm was seen in the left superior medastinum . The mass also contained a bizarre - shaped vascular structure that was connected to left innominate vein . The contrast directly entered the vascular components of the masses via an abnormal vein .

The correlation between depression and parkinson disease has remained unclear among iranian population . The roles of demographic and disease - related variables are not fully described in the association between depression . The prevalence of depression and the effect of demographic factors were assessed in patients with pd living in kermanshah province, iran .

Multiple sclerosis council defines ms related fatigue as a  subjective lack of physical and/or mental energy that is perceived by the individual or caregiver to interfere with usual and desired activities . In general there are no objective measurements to differentiate fatigue from exhaustion . Complaints of fatigue may be as important as those of sleepiness are to obstructive sleep apnea syndrome ( osas ) patients . continuous positive airway pressure (cpap) improves fatigue substantially in osas patients .

Currently, chronic kidney disease (ckd) is one of the most serious public health problems . Approximately one million people  with end stage renal disease ( esrd) undergo replacement therapy worldwide . The increased prevalence of ckd in developed and developing countries threatens to become a global epidemic .

Autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease ( adpkd) is an inherited disorder characterized by the development and growth of cysts in the kidneys and other organs . In 85% of the cases, the disease is caused by a mutation localized on chromosome 16 ( pkd1) and in 15% by mutation on chromosome 4 . The association of nephrotic syndrome with the disease with glomerulonephritis is rare and needs to be investigated further to exclude coexisting glomerular disease .

It consists of a pair of cylindrically shaped centrioles surrounded by fibrous pericentriolar material . Each cylinder serves as a template for the assembly of a new daughter centriole . before mitosis, when cells contain two pairs of centioles, each pair serves as nucleation center for microtubules of the spindle apparatus . defects in centrosome assembly can result in the formation of monopolar spindles and mitotic arrest ( sunkel et al . several years ago, evidence was published that defective centrosomes prevent cells from entering s phase .

A male neonate born to g2 p1l1 mother at term by spontaneous vaginal delivery was found to have proximal shortening of both upper and lower limbs . The neonate also had coronal clefts of thoracic vertebrae and stippled epiphysis of femur tibia and humerus . The baby developed progressively severe respiratory distress and was discharged at request on day 3 of life as the parents were unable to come to terms with the diagnosis .

Radioactive iodine thyroid ablation has been shown to be an inexpensive, safe and effective treatment for hyperthyroidism . It is the most commonly used method for treating adult patients with graves ' disease . Special precautions must be used in women of child - bearing age because of the possible detrimental side effects of fetal exposure . Pregnancy should be ruled out using four criteria: negative hcg test obtained within 72 hours prior to treatment .

cardiovascular diseases ( cvds ) accounts for 17.7 million annual deaths in world - wide . Half of deaths and 80% of the related global burden occur in developing countries . The contribution of every risk factor to the avoidable / attributable burden of diseases can be calculated by a measure entitled  potential impact fraction ( pif ) The pif is a measure of effect that calculates the proportional change in average disease incidence after a change in exposure of a related risk factor .

Setsapp is a cytoscape 3 application that provides a set of tools for users and developers to define and maintain sets of nodes or edges . The user interface, command interface and underlying data model are three main components to the  setsapp implementation . A simple app and a bundle app are implemented using the same general approach as in cytoscapes 2.8 .

200 000 inhospital cardiac arrests ( ihca ) occur in the united states each year with overall survival rates of 18% to 20% . The extent to which hospitals vary in survival rates remains poorly understood . This study was a multicenter cohort study using data from the american heart association 's get with the guidelinesresuscitation ( gwtgr) to calculate hospital riskadjusted survival rates for ihc .

Glioblastoma is the most frequent type of brain tumor and the median survival time is 2 years after diagnosis . at present, no effective treatment has been developed for patients . known risk factors, high - dose ionizing radiation , and smoking account for only a small proportion of cases . Genome - wide association studies have found that some sites have relationships with glioma .

Caregiver is an individual who has the responsibility of meeting the physical and psychological needs of the dependent patient . Psychiatric patients need assistance or supervision in their daily activities and this often places a major burden on their caregivers . The burden perceived by caregivers of patients with psychiatric illness is a fundamental prognostic aspect as the caregiver burden is reportedly a critical determinant for negative caregiving outcomes .

Anesthesia providers routinely care for patients undergoing magnetic resonance imaging ( mri ) and the implications for patient care are well known . However, there is scant literature on the occupational hazards of mri for health care workers . Exposure to a magnetic field of sufficient strength from an mri scanner can cause vertigo . herein, we describe one case of an anesthetist experiencing acute vertigo while caring for a patient undergoing a scan in a 3 t mri machine .

Levels of obesity have been increasing since the 1950s ( albeit slowly, initially ) in the usa and other developed countries . Life expectancy has continued to increase at an undiminished rate . cardiovascular - specific mortality rates have also decreased continually . Other factors driving mortality down include population - wide changes such as reductions in the prevalence and intensity of smoking .

Although the peripheral nervous system has the ability to regenerate axons following injury , when nerve gaps are larger than 12 cm, bridging strategies are required for repair . in such cases, autologous nerve grafts have been used as the gold standard . in order to overcome these issues, scaffold bridging materials that may be synthetic, absorbable or non - absorbable have been studied vigorously . through these studies,  several criteria were suggested to be necessary for better results .

A case of incidentally detected anomalous position of gall bladder causing confounding problem in interpretation of pet - ct . The most common of these are under the left hepatic lobe, (2 ) intrahepatic , ( 3 ) transverse , and ( 4 ) retroplaced .

Digital intraoral radiographic systems have several advantages compared with conventional film - based radiography . Carcinoid tumors develop from stem cells of the bronchial epithelium known as kulchitsky cells . These neuroendocrine cells can develop tumors in many different organs . The development of carcinoid pulmonary tumors is not related to smoking or other environmental causes .

Familial mediterranean fever ( fmf) is a genetic , autosomal recessive disease affecting primarily non - ashkenazi jews, turks, arabs, and armenians . The fmF gene that encodes pyrin / marenostrin is mapped to chromosome 16 . Patients have an increased erythrocyte sedimentation rate ( esr ) , c - reactive protein ( crp ) , serum amyloid a ( saa ) levels during these attacks and usually , this increase returns to normal values in attack - free periods . Subclinical inflammation may continue in attack-free periods .

cone beam computed tomography ( cbct) was introduced to the dental field to replace the cumbersome , expensive , and high - radiation producing medical ct scans around a decade ago . Cbct has lesser radiation than msct and 10 times more radiation than a panoramic x - ray . The radiation dose of radiation should be reported in millisievert ( msv ) or microsievert (sv) to express the effective dose (e) The e of radiation has been recommended by the icrp as a means of comparing the detriment of different exposures to ionizing radiation to an equivalent dose .

The posttraumatic immune response is characterized by a complex set of pro- and anti - inflammatory reactions in order to restore homeostasis . The splenic immune response and cellular immunity are known to be depressed after trauma - hemorrhage leading to an increased susceptibility to infectious complications . The aim of the present pilot study was to investigate whether femoral fracture with or without hemorrhagic shock has an impact on the splenic cytokine production capacity at an early posttraumatic stage .

Lipoma is the most common soft tissue mesenchymal neoplasm in adults . The majority occurs in the upper - half of the body, particularly the trunk, head and neck region . The current amoeba force field seemingly compensates for penetration with a less repulsive van der waals interaction so the total interaction energy is reasonable at certain dimer configurations .

A 43 -year - old man was admitted to our institute with a 3-month history of dysphagia and neck pain with swelling . He was paraplegic due to a c6 - 7 fracture and dislocation and has been operated on 8 years previously . A loose screw was removed and esophageal perforation was found during surgery and repaired directly by a cardiovascular team . The patient was fed using a nasogastric tube for 3 weeks and oral feeding was gradually resumed .

The primary purpose of this work was to analyze the efficacy and limitations of 2.5% p - i eyedrops for the prophylaxis of on in angola . The use of povidone - iodine ( p -i ) has been advocated for the less developed countries, but few well - designed prospective , randomized , and controlled clinical studies have been performed with this agent . This substance is well tolerated, has a broader spectrum than other anti - infectious agents, does not induce resistance .

The indications for our approach were as follows : ( 1 ) isolated pcl avulsion fracture; and ( 2 ) posterior tibial sag present at 90 of knee flexion . The patients were placed in the prone position, with the knee flexed 20 to 30, with an oblique incision of < 10 cm made between semitendinosus tendon and medial head of the gastrocnemius . 2 suture based anchors ( 3.5 mm ; biomet sports medicine , warsaw , in , usa ) were inserted into the superomedial and superolateral region of the fracture site . The use of a knotless anchor provides a compressive force and fixes the reduced avulsion fragment strongly to the fracture bed .

The species flocks of the east african great lakes are well - known examples for rapid evolution and speciation . We postulate that given the high potential for gene flow, diversification of lineages will either be curtailed ( as suggested by the relative species paucity ) or be attended by strong reproductive isolation right from the start .

The use of chemotherapeutic drugs to control internal and external parasites is a widespread practice in livestock production . Failure of anthelmintics and reduced efficacy due to resistance of nematodes in sheep and goats are becoming a threat in some countries and are of increasing importance in certain african countries . The aim of this study was to evaluate resistance in west african dwarf goats to levamisole , albendazole , and ivermectin and v. amygdalina .

Maca is an endemic highland crop of the central andes which is grown from central peru to bolivia and northwestern argentina . The plant has great potential as an adaptogen and appears to be promising as a nutraceutical in the prevention of several diseases . Commercial maca products have gained popularity as dietary supplements for aphrodisiac purposes and for increasing fertility and stamina .

Myrtus communis is an evergreen shrub belonging to the family of mirtaceae that grows spontaneously throughout the mediterranean area . The essential oil obtained from leaves and flowers and berries has been used for its tonic and balsamic properties . In this study we have used this essential oil towards strains of m. tuberculosis and strains of mycobacterium avium subsp . We also studied the antimicrobial properties of the essential oil against several clinical strains and in particular against helicobacter pylori .

This article is an open-access to the author's knowledge of events in the U.S. national history . The author also provided an analysis of the events in this article .

The mesenchymal tumors of the gastrointestinal ( gi ) tract have been called as various names including stromal tumor of unknown malignant potential ( stump) and gastrointestinal pacemaker cell tumors ( gipact) The gists presumed to derive from stem cells differentiating to the gi pacemaker cells . Nearly all gists are implicated with c - kit gene abnormality and cd117 (c - kit) overexpression .

A layer of enhanced aerosol scattering associated with the asian summer monsoon was observed by stratospheric aerosol and gas experiment ii ( sage ii) and calipso [ vernier et al .  The asian tropopause aerosol layer ( atal ) occurs during june - july - august in the broad region bounded by 0160e , 1545n . The atal may originate from emissions over a wide region, including both europe and asia .

Californium-252 is an artificial element with a half - life of 2.645 years . It decays via either alpha emission ( 96.9% ) or spontaneous fission ( 3.1% ) of the artificial element . It emits both photons and neutrons ( 2.3110 n / s/g ) of varied energy . The combination of brachytherapy and neutron captures may improve tumor dose noticeably .

The transposable element ( te ) was first described by mcclintock   as a controlling element that jumps from one position to another in the maize chromosome in the mid-1940s . It was in the late 1970s and early 1980s when insertion sequence ( is ) elements and transposons ( tn ) were discovered and found to be similar to mccs' controlling elements . Retrotransposable elements ( rtes ) were being added to the repertoire since the 1980s to make the picture diverse and complicated .

Smoking is estimated to account for approximately 4 - 5 million deaths worldwide and approximately 443,000 deaths each year in the united states alone . Tobacco smoking is a major risk factor associated with the development and progression of a variety of cancers . Polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons and nicotine - derived nitrosamines have been identified as the major and potent carcinogens . These agents form dna adducts and cause mutations in vital genes like rb , p53 , and k - ras in smokers .

The goal of this paper is to review repair techniques for imr used over the past 25 years at duke university medical center at Duke University medical center . The paper reviews surgical approaches and technical outcomes of mitral repair in ischemic mitral regurgitation . It is likely that outcome benefits did vary between institutions with differences in surgery and other factors .

Analysis of the coding potential of 481 prokaryotic genomes revealed the surprisingly high frequency of alternate orfs of annotated genes . Almost every annotated orf exhibits an alternative orf that could potentially encode a protein of 100 amino acids or more . This high frequency provokes serious problems of gene annotation where the incorrect orf may inadvertently be mis - annotated as the coding sequence .

Cardiovascular disease is the leading cause of death in end - stage renal disease ( esrd ) patients receiving long - term peritoneal dialysis ( pd ) therapy . Nearly half of the mortality in pd patients was due to cardiovascular disease . At least 60% to 80% of the patients were complicated with coronary artery calcification .

Colistin belongs to the polymyxin class of antibiotics which is a group of cationic polypeptides . popularity rapidly faded in 1970s because of significant renal and neurological toxicity and was replaced with less toxic antibiotics with a comparable or broader antibacterial spectrum such as aminoglycosides . with the emergence of multi drug - resistant (mdr ) gram - negative organisms, in particular pseudomonas aeruginosa , acinetobacter baumannii , and klebsiella pneumonia , colistin has been reconsidered as a potential therapeutic agent for the past 10 - 15 years .

Deep brain stimulators ( dbs) are increasingly used to treat carefully selected cases of movement disorders, pain and psychiatric disorders that respond poorly to medical therapy . Patients with long standing parkinson disease ( pd ) with dbs for surgery pose significant challenges to the anaesthesiologist in view of primary pathology, multisystem involvement , potential drug interactions , and risk of dbs malfunction by interference with monitoring and therapeutic electromagnetic devices .

The results of dif are sufficiently useful in the . diagnosis of chronic ulcerative diseases of the oral mucosa .

The ectoparasitic mite causes relatively little harm to its original host the asian honey bee, apis cerana . The varroa destructor mite feeds on bee hemolymph and reproduces in the brood cells of pupating bees . The mite is in part responsible for the recent global honey bee colony losses that have caused ecological and economical pressures on plant biodiversity .

The isotopes of a given element may show some quantitative differences in chemical reaction equilibria and/or reaction rates . The purpose of the work is to study the isotope effect of neodymium in ligand exchange system using glycolic , malic and citric acids as mono , di and tri carboxylic acid to compare the effect of different ligands on isotope .

The world health organization has made prevention of visual impairment ( vi ) an international priority . The first service objective is to reduce new blindness due to diabetic retinopathy ( dr) The standard acceptable annual registration rate for severe vi and vi due to dr is 9.5 and 9.3 per million per year for england and wales . The minimum standard achievable is a 10% reduction in vi registration rate within 5 years of the screening program . The desirable standard is 40% reduction .

The modern concept of decompression for traumatic brain injury ( tbi ) was introduced by harvey cushing before world war i . Malaria transmission is driven by a complex interaction of the vector, parasite , human host , and the environment .

The practice of psychiatry and the shift to noninstitutional care of severe psychiatric disorders are the result of antipsychotic medications . First - generation or typical antipsychotics were effective in treating positive symptoms of psychosis such as hallucination and delusion but did not alleviate negative symptoms of withdrawal, apathy, cognitive impairment , or loss of affect . A series of newer drugs began emerging in 1989 called second generation or atypical antipsychots . These drugs are thought to be more effective than the older agents in alleviating the negative , cognitive , and affective symptoms with fewer extrapyramidal adverse effects . The principal concern for endocrinologists with the newer drugs has been the metabolic effects of weight gain, glucose intolerance, hyperlipidemia , and hypertension .

The auditory brainstem implant ( abi) has been used to treat deafness in individuals with neurofibromatosis type 2 since the first device was implanted in 1979 . We describe successful noninvasive management for iatrogenic penetrating splenic injury caused by chest tube insertion .
